metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1669 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Zone::New function in zone.cc in Google V8 before 5.0.71.47, as used inGoogle Chrome before 50.0.2661.102, does not properly determine when toexpand certain memory allocations, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
